**Item #:** SCP-ZH-161

**Object Class:** Safe

**Special Containment Procedure:** Currently, the whereabouts of Unreality Department liaison Alex Thorley should be identified and located.

**Description:** SCP-ZH-161 is an anomalous phenomenon which affects the Unreality Department liaison office, in which most items and the environment are hard to identify and comprehend both sensationally and conceptually[[footnote]]This is thought to be the result of gradual detachment over a long period of time.[[/footnote]], and the items that are identifiable will move on their own during typical Foundation work days. The list of items is shown below.

[!-- mobile fix, remove if language is in logographic system --]
[[div class="mobiletable"]]
||~ Time frame ||~ Item ||~ Event description ||
|| Irregular, usually 01:00-10:00 || Bed || Wrinkles on the bedsheet appear and change over time; the bed frame squeaks every 3 minutes to 2 hours. ||
|| 09:30 || White mug || 10-15 grams of bitumen granules appear inside, then turn into liquid (around 250ml) after 5 minutes and disappears over time (3 hours on average). ||
|| 10:00-14:00 || [[span style="white-space: nowrap"]]Keyboard[[footnote]]Without text or symbols[[/footnote]] and mouse[[/span]]/ _
Computer screen || Frequently being pressed; of which frequency of the mouse's usage is higher than that of the keyboard./ _
The content are mostly inquisitive emails to the Unreality Department from other departments. All are marked as unread.||
|| 13:00 || White mug || Water appears within and disappears over time (12 minutes on average). ||
|| 14:00 || Fridge || Opens for 3 minutes; empty. ||
|| 14:15 || Microwave  || Defrost mode for 3 minutes, High power for 4 minutes, Medium power for 3 minutes. The content of the lunch box is unidentifiable except for the metaphysical property of "edible". ||
|| 15:00-18:00 ||  [[span style="white-space: nowrap"]]Keyboard and mouse[[/span]]/ _
Computer screen || Frequently being pressed; of which frequency of the mouse's usage is higher than that of the keyboard./ _
The content are mostly inquisitive emails to the Unreality Department from other departments. All are marked as unread.||
|| 18:50 || White mug || Water appears within and disappears over time (4 minutes on average). The mug then slowly melts to the drain in the kitchen sink. ||
|| 19:00 || Fridge || Opens for 15 minutes; empty. ||
|| 19:50 || Microwave  || Defrost mode for 3 minutes, High power for 4 minutes, Medium power for 3 minutes. The content of the lunch box is unidentifiable except for the metaphysical property of "edible". ||
|| 22:00-24:00 || Bed || Wrinkles on the bedsheet appear and change; water stains sometimes appear on the pillow. ||
[[/div]]

Movements are rarely seen in non-working days, except for:
* Bed: Wrinkles on the bedsheet occasionally change
* Office chair: Moves to the centre of the room and facing a wall 

It should be noted that Alex Thorley cannot be found within the office premise.
@@ @@
**History:** 

SCP-ZH-161 was first discovered on 21/2/2027[[footnote]]Alex Thorley being in their position for exactly 5 years [[/footnote]] by a patrolling security personnel in Site-19. The office door was half-opened, and as such the personnel was able to observe its primary anomalous effect.

Note that Alex Thorley has zero record of absence from onboarding to this very day.
 
**Addendum:** Incident 

On May 2029, according to Foundation labour policies,  Department of Human Resources sent an email to Alex Thorley regarding a mandatory one-week leave, and temporally removed their right of access from SCiPnet, no response was received. However, during the aforementioned week, the office suffered from a second-degree detachment, and the sole identifiable thing was an unidentifiable cassette-like voice repeating "I don't know" which persisted for 98 hours 22 minutes and 7 seconds. No conclusion was made regarding the forensic analysis of the audio.
